issues.description: The problem statement (UML and tasks) specifies a method getTotalNumberOfStudents() with no parameters returning an int. The solution implementation instead defines getTotalNumberOfStudents(boolean includeGuests) — i.e. the method has an extra boolean parameter. This is a cross-artifact method signature mismatch: students following the specification will implement a no-argument method, but the solution (and any tests derived from it) uses a different signature. This can confuse students and break automated checking or reference comparisons.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the solution with the problem specification by changing the solution method to the no-argument signature declared in the UML: public int getTotalNumberOfStudents(). Implement it to return the sum of inscribed and guest students (e.g. return numberOfInscribedStudents + numberOfGuestStudents;). Then update any internal calls in the solution (e.g. getNameAndTotalNumberOfStudents and getNumberOfStudentsPerTutor) to call the no-arg method. Alternatively, if the boolean parameter was intentional, update the problem statement and UML to document the includeGuests parameter and its semantics so students know the correct signature.

issues.description: The problem statement (UML and task description) requires a no-argument method getTotalNumberOfStudents() that returns the total number of students. The solution implementation instead defines getTotalNumberOfStudents(boolean includeGuests) (a method with a boolean parameter). This changes the API/contract for the same conceptual entity and will confuse students: the task text and UML indicate a no-arg method, but the reference solution requires a boolean argument. Students may implement the no-arg method as asked and find the solution code/tests do not match, or be unsure whether guests should be included by default.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the solution repository with the problem statement by providing a no-argument getTotalNumberOfStudents() method that returns the total number of students (as specified in the UML). If the boolean option to include/exclude guests is desired, add an overloaded method getTotalNumberOfStudents(boolean includeGuests) or implement the no-arg method to delegate to the boolean version (e.g. public int getTotalNumberOfStudents() { return getTotalNumberOfStudents(true); }). This preserves the expected API while keeping the extended behavior if needed.
